intro: Mimulus diffusus, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant yellow flowers with two lips, a characteristic feature of the Physaleae tribe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Mimulus diffusus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
